H0.text: Which part of the body can suffer from cirrhosis. Pancreas

H1.text: Which part of the body can suffer from cirrhosis. Kidneys

H2.text: Which part of the body can suffer from cirrhosis. Lungs

H3.text: Which part of the body can suffer from cirrhosis. Liver

A4.text: Cirrhosis is a chronic condition of the liver in which the normal functioning tissue, or parenchyma, is replaced with scar tissue (fibrosis) and regenerative nodules as a result of chronic liver disease.

A5.text: Cirrhosis is defined by its features on microscopy: (1) the presence of regenerating nodules of hepatocytes and (2) the presence of fibrosis, or the deposition of connective tissue between these nodules.
